intro: Crotalaria kwengeensis var. kwengeensis, commonly known as the Kwenge crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with compound leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in semi-arid to moist environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and potential agricultural applications.
